title: (x) Imperial formal script - Ariston {Rainer}
content:
Hi

Anyone recognize this familiar-looking-but-apparently-not-on-Myfonts script face?

Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121222225im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Imperial_6609.gif)

 [‹ Sacred Heart blackletter, similar to Fette Fraktur](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121222225/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38360 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Did you know" hand printed kiddie script - Lemonade ICG Bold {Simon Gray} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121222225/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38345 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Richard Hunt

comments.content: Ariston. And it is for sure on MyFonts …

Yes, [here it is](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121222225/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/ariston-bq/), the Extra to be precise …

BTW; The Whatthefont-engine works best with samples with splitted letters …

Thanks Renko.

I had dialed in “formal scripts”, and searched through the list, which is why I didn’t find it.

You are welcome, Richard. Reason is why you haven’t found it with »formal script« because the typeface itself is tagged only with the keyword »script«. Hmm …

I’ll suggest some other keywords at the button below. Let’s see if the MyFonts-Team likes them, too.
